programme.title: The Day the Earth Stopped (2008)
programme.desc: The Earth is invaded by a force of powerful alien robots who offer the human race an ultimatum - justify its right to exist, or be wiped out. Sci-fi drama, directed by and starring C Thomas Howell. With Judd Nelson and Darren Dalton

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A girl's death leads Walker to investigate a factory that may be polluting the town's water supply. Adventure, starring Chuck Norris

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Part one of two. A former convict shoots Alex in a revenge attack - just as Walker prepares to propose marriage to her. Adventure, starring Sheree J Wilson and Chuck Norris

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Part two of two. Alex is wounded at Kim and Phil's wedding. Adventure with the modern-day lawman whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Walker helps to free an elderly man who is falsely accused of a crime

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Trivette infiltrates the gang of a career criminal who is out on parole and back to his old ways, and Alex opens her rehabilitation centre to help steer youngsters away from crime

programme.title: Jet Stream (2012)
programme.desc: A TV weatherman tries to prove his theory that a number of unexplained catastrophes are the result of powerful winds found in the upper atmosphere coming down to ground level. His claims attract the attention of government scientists, who need his help to control the phenomena before it destroys all life on Earth. Disaster movie, starring David Chokachi, Don Michael Paul and Preston James Hillier

programme.title: Descent (2005)
programme.desc: When volcanic activity in the Pacific reaches unprecedented levels, a team of scientists is recruited by the US government to avert a catastrophe. However, one of the group realises that his new employers may be responsible for the looming disaster. Sci-fi drama, starring Luke Perry, Natalie Brown and Michael Dorn

programme.title: G-Loc (2020)
programme.desc: After fleeing a dying Earth for a newer solar system, a man and his trusty AI companion find themselves aboard an antagonistic enemy ship. Sci-fi thriller, starring Stephen Moyer and Casper Van Dien

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: A man's obsession with his ideal woman drives him to acquire a love potion _ with unexpected consequences

programme.title: Money Plane (2020)
programme.desc: A professional thief who owes the mob money is forced to rob a futuristic flying casino filled with the world's most dangerous criminals. Action, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Sniper: Special Ops (2016)
programme.desc: An elite military force is sent on a rescue mission which proves successful, but one of the soldiers is left behind when he goes to help a wounded man. The leader of the squad is forbidden from going back for him, but disobeys orders to lead his men on a desperate rescue mission. Action thriller, starring Steven Seagal and Tim Abell

programme.title: The Ascent (2019)
programme.desc: A special ops unit are sent to infiltrate a civil war to retrieve intel. The squad soon find themselves trapped on a seemingly endless staircase, and are forced to climb or die. To survive, they must revisit their past sins if they ever want to escape. Horror thriller, starring Shayne Ward, Sophie Austin and Alana Wallace

programme.title: Spring (2014)
programme.desc: An American man travels to Italy, where he begins a romance with a beautiful young genetics student who hides a dark and primordial secret. Horror, starring Lou Taylor Pucci and Nadia Hilker

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A gifted intern learns her true heritage and faces a challenging question. Sci-fi adventure, guest starring Olivia D'Abo and John de Lancie

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard, Ensign Ro, Keiko and Guinan are transformed into children just as the Ferengi attack, claiming the Enterprise as salvage. Sci-fi adventure, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The crew takes up leisure pursuits to pass the time - but Worf's enjoyment is cut short when the holodeck malfunctions. Sci-fi fantasy, starring Patrick Stewart and Michael Dorn

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Data believes a life-form is emerging when he is introduced to a new invention - mobile computers. Sci-fi drama, starring Patrick Stewart and Brent Spiner

programme.title: Wyvern (2009)
programme.desc: A giant flying reptile that has been frozen in the Arctic icecaps for centuries is revived by global warming and goes in search of prey. It chooses a remote Alaskan town as its hunting ground, and the townsfolk prepare to make a desperate stand against the monster. Fantasy thriller, starring Nick Chinlund and Erin Karpluk

programme.title: Moby Dick (2010)
programme.desc: A submarine is attacked by a monstrous whale, but the captain survives despite losing his leg in the process. Decades later, he is placed in charge of a new experimental submarine, but is still consumed with a desire for revenge on the creature, and recruits a scientist to help him hunt it down. Thriller, starring Barry Bostwick and Renee O'Connor

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes (2010)
programme.desc: The renowned detective and his sidekick Dr Watson are on the trail of a criminal and scientific mastermind who seems to control monsters and creations that are beyond belief. Mystery, starring Ben Syder, Gareth David-Lloyd and Dominic Keating

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: A trumpet player finds himself hovering between life and death after a road accident

programme.title: Dracula: Prince of Darkness (1966)
programme.desc: The undead count is revived by the blood of an English tourist, who was lured with his wife and two friends to Dracula's remote Carpathian castle by his butler. Now wanting his victim's widow for his bride, he pursues her to a monastery, where she has sought sanctuary - but reckons without the intervention of a brave clergyman. Hammer horror, with Christopher Lee, Barbara Shelley, Andrew Keir, Francis Matthews and Philip Latham

programme.title: Frankenstein Created Woman (1967)
programme.desc: Baron Frankenstein has acquired the dead body of a woman, but lacks the means to bring it to life. He finds success by transplanting the soul of a killer into the corpse, with predictably gruesome results. Hammer horror, starring Peter Cushing, Thorley Walters, Susan Denberg and Robert Morris

programme.title: Odd Thomas (2013)
programme.desc: A cook has the ability to see ghosts, and is startled to find a stranger in his town has attracted an unusually large number of spirits. He takes this as a sign that this man is going to cause a terrible disaster, so tries to find out what is going to happen and if it can be stopped. Supernatural thriller based on Dean Koontz's novel, starring Anton Yelchin and Willem Dafoe

programme.title: Mindscape (2013)
programme.desc: A psychic with the ability to explore people's memories uses his talents to aid the police, until a case goes disastrously wrong. Desperate for work, he agrees to help a wealthy couple discover why their teenage daughter is on a hunger strike, but beings to fear she is manipulating her memories to deceive him. Fantasy thriller, starring Mark Strong, Taissa Farmiga and Brian Cox

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard leaves the Enterprise to lead Worf and Dr Crusher on an espionage mission to Cardassia, in an effort to prevent war - but the task proves more dangerous than any of them anticipated. Ronny Cox and David Warner guest star

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: 30 Days of Night (2007)
programme.desc: A horde of vampires finds the perfect hunting ground - a town in Alaska that remains sunless for a month. Horror, with Josh Hartnett, Danny Huston and Melissa George

programme.title: The Butterfly Room (2012)
programme.desc: A butterfly-obsessed recluse develops a strange, maternal relationship with a younger woman, until a sudden betrayal and her own dark past drive her to secretly commit terrible crimes. A nine-year-old girl suspects something sinister is going on and investigates, leading her into terrible danger. Thriller, starring Barbara Steele and Heather Langenkamp

programme.title: Iron Sky: The Coming Race (2019)
programme.desc: It's 2047 and Earth has been destroyed by nuclear war. The last of mankind, struggling to co-exist on the moon, race to battle an extraordinary enemy and save humanity. programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the start of the 43rd staging of the 26.2-mile race, as approximately 50,000 competitors take to the streets of the capital. programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Joe is horrified at the toll London life is taken on an opium-addicted Pip, and tries to persuade him to return to the safety of Gravesend. An unsuspected threat from the past emerges when Pip discovers the true identity of his mysterious benefactor. Frustrated by Estella's reluctance to marry Drummle, Miss Havisham foists another unsuspected suitor on her daughter, who is driven to desperate lengths to seize control of her life

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Bournemouth v West Ham United at Vitality Stadium and Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur at St James' Park. He becomes fascinated by a mysterious American who moves in next door, and the new arrival offers him some advice on how to be cool. In a bid to convince Grace to come back to the work, Stevie calls round to her house and finally reveals something intimate about his personal life

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and Jake travel to London and start the final countdown to the birth. However, tensions run high and tempers frayed as the days close in. Jake turns to his brother Rhys for advice and Charlotte confides in best friend Lauren

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte experiences the most joyous days of her life as Alba Jean is born. Later, Leticia and Gary meet the new arrival and Charlotte heads back to a shoot as a working mother. However, just weeks later the family is devastated by the sudden loss of nana Jean and all concerned struggle to cope with the overwhelming grief

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts the semi-final of the cooking challenge. Mary Berry challenges the remaining contestants to prepare a fish supper, Chris Bavin asks them to come up with a meal that puts mushrooms front and centre, and Angela Hartnett sets them the task of making crab ravioli with homemade pasta dough. After a dramatic end to the final challenge, one more celebrity leaves the kitchen

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Musgrave Park. England will go into this match as strong favourites given their superior form so far this year and their emphatic 69-0 victory when the sides met in Leicester last year

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the afternoon session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two second-round matches - Jak Jones v Neil Robertson and Ronnie O'Sullivan v Hossein Vafaei

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Adam Partridge and Christina Trevanion value objects at Hereford Cathedral, while presenter Paul Martin attempts to make a traditional wooden stool

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the factory making 432 million crumpets every year, where quality controller Stuart Jones shows him the speciality flour that includes 13 varieties of wheat. Cherry Healey learns the science of how to make the perfect batter for pancakes and visits a factory in Manchester that makes another British favourite - Eccles cakes, which are shipped all over the world. Historian Ruth Goodman reveals the long journey of how crumpets got their rise and eventually their bubbles, and traces the history of our obsession with toasting our baked goods

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of two second-round matches. Mark Selby will be involved in one of these contests should he have come through his first-round encounter and will be looking to avoid his fate at this stage last year, when the 2021 champion relinquished his crown following a 13-10 defeat at the hands of Yan Bingtao

programme.title: Piano Greats at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of songs from the kings and queens of the keyboards, whose performances have captivated audiences over the decades across a selection of the BBC's best-loved music programmes. From piano pioneers like Little Richard, Nina Simone and Ray Charles, who showed the world that the new sounds of pop and rock didn't just revolve around guitars, right through to modern maestros like Elton John, Lady Gaga and Jools Holland

programme.title: Little Richard: King and Queen of Rock 'n' Roll
programme.desc: The life and career of the pioneering musician, a black artist who grew up in the segregated American South and broke down barriers and took 1950s America by storm. The Beatles and the Rolling Stones supported him and took inspiration from his musicianship and stagecraft, and he went on to influence artists as diverse as David Bowie, Elton John, Michael Jackson and Prince. Featuring interviews with Ringo Starr, Keith Richards, Nile Rodgers and Big Freedia, alongside intimate contributions from friends, bandmates and Little Richard himself, this feature-length documentary tells the story of a rollercoaster life

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from second-round matches on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of a second-round match from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: In the medieval city of Coimbra, Millie, Su, Vickie, Shane and Bobby visit the St Theresa convent, Nabil finds a mosque for Friday prayers and invites Rita to join him. Keen to connect with her own Jewish culture, Rita seeks out an old synagogue in Tamar and asks Millie to accompany her. Then after 14 days and 364 kilometres, the group finally reaches the Sanctuary of Fatima

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill finally has her own garden and can't wait to share her plans and get to grips with bringing this compact space to life. Toby Buckland meets a man who's planted his plot with a wonderful array of fruit and nuts. And cameras focus on a gardener in Gloucestershire who discusses the 500 pot plants she's designed especially to produce a floral firework display

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team helps launch the Wild Britain campaign to protect the UK's wildlife. Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin join volunteers transforming an old playing field on the Lincolnshire Fens into a wildlife haven. John Craven heads to Chester Zoo, and Tom Heap looks at the UK's track record for protecting nature, and if a new bill currently going through parliament could undermine it. With special appearances from nature lovers Judi Dench and Deborah Meaden

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Lizzie Schofield and Calum Clunie have tips for making gardens as productive as possible, while the team clears up winter storm damage - taking down a fence damaged in the high winds of January and coming up with a creative alternative

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: A special marine edition of the programme, with Dougie Vipond in Arran to find out how 15 years of a fishing ban has transformed a No Take Zone in Lamlash Bay. Arlene Stuart gets an insight into trout breeding she'll never forget. The town of Cromarty has a population of just 700, but 100 of them are coastal rowers, so Anne Lundon takes to the sea to investigate why it is such a fast growing pastime

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.desc: Samantha Evans and Shauna Guinn travel to the small town of Deri near Caerphilly to celebrate the success of its rugby club, which has gone from the brink of extinction just four years ago to being crowned league champions. To mark the achievements of the players and the volunteers who run the club, Sam and Shauna cook up a huge venison feast with their help

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of economic recipes, including a Bake Off masterclass featuring Sussex suet pond pudding, and a James Martin tomato soup with garlic bread

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: To celebrate the feast day of St George, Laura Wright heads to London to meet families uncovering the story of England's patron saint on a dragon-finding walking tour. The group explores the City, an area of the capital that features the dragon and St George's flag on many of its monuments and landmarks. With hymns throughout the programme honouring England's patron saint and a special performance from St Paul's Cathedral Choir

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, as many of the approximately 50,000 runners make their way towards the finish line

programme.desc: From the Boconnoc estate in the Cornish countryside, antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Nick Hall uncover a pair of Georgian chairs and a children's pedal fire engine

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Action from the 43rd staging of the race, including the key moments from the elite men's, women's and wheelchair races

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day nine at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as two second-round matches continue, including Kyren Wilson v John Higgins. The pair experienced mixed fortunes at this stage last year, with 2020 runner-up Wilson losing to Stuart Bingham and four-time champion Higgins prevailing against Noppon Saengkham

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charles III has long been a champion of the countryside, so Charlotte Smith and Hamza Yassin travel to Dumfries House, a showcase for His Majesty's passion for rural life. Charlotte meets schoolchildren at the estate's education farm and garden to find out about the King's ambition to create the next generation of nature-loving food producers, and his mission to reinvigorate traditional crafts. Hamza discovers how the 2,000-acre estate has been transformed to help wildlife, and welcomes the newest residents to the walled garden - hedgehogs

programme.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe
programme.desc: The comedian heads to Jordan as she takes on more of the world's endangered jobs, learning how to be a Dead Sea lifeguard and spending a night in the desert with a family of Bedouin herders on the lookout for dangerous animals

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: When Ashley leaves a mess in Gordon's sock drawer, she makes an impromptu trip to Costco with Colin, Megan and her mother to buy him some new furniture

programme.desc: Action from day nine at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring second-round matches

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of a second-round match from Sheffield, as the tournament won by Ronnie O'Sullivan last year continued at the Crucible Theatre

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from York, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing questions from the audience

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife that lives in Britain's freshwater environments. Atlantic salmon battle their way upstream in one of the greatest migrations on the planet, beavers slow the flow with their expert dam-building, and toadlets have to cross a killing zone patrolled by carnivorous leeches. Where rivers spread out to form beds of reeds, great crested grebes pair up in courtship ceremonies, and small agile birds of prey swoop low to catch dragonflies

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers bid on a wooden toy bus, a unicycle, a hand-made model of a mill, a Norwegian pan from the 1970s and a ladder believed to have been used in a French library in the early 20th century. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a deer farm near Bodmin Moor run by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of West Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: At mainland Wales' most northerly point in Flintshire, Derek Brockway's latest walk starts off at the site of the Point of Ayr Colliery at the mouth of the Dee estuary. There, Derek meets John Wiltshire, who is passionate about keeping the memory of the mine alive. Derek lends a hand, helping endangered species in the sand dunes, and little terns who nest on the beach just over the Denbighshire border. Around 10 miles on, in 'Sunny Rhyl', Derek learns to kitesurf and do the surfers' shaka

programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics Live

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Former footballer Neil Ruddock checks in and Sharon and Alex want to give him the opportunity to learn more about the local produce, so he goes to Glenarm Castle's estate to see their shorthorn cattle. Armed with a rack of ribs, they create a delicious dinner for the whole B&B team. Knowing Neil might need to brush up on his Northern Irish history, Sharon takes him to Londonderry for a lesson. Famous for its intact 17th-century walls, the city is one of the few in Europe that never saw its fortifications breached

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day 10 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of the final two second-round matches, including Anthony McGill v Jack Lisowski, as the line-up for the quarter-finals is confirmed. Lisowski was the final player to book his place in the last eight in 2022, edging out 2010 champion Neil Robertson 13-12

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie asks the questions as six contestants take to the famous black chair in the final of the quiz. The specialist subjects are British & Irish Lions tours in the 21st century, Princess Margaret, the Rocky films, Bletchley Park during the Second World War, Augustus Caesar, and the BBC sitcom Extras, before the contenders are tested on their general knowledge and the winner is crowned

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The quarter-final stage continues, with two teams who have both won one match and lost another having one last chance to qualify for the semi-finals, with the losing quartet being eliminated. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: University Challenge at 60
programme.desc: Samira Ahmed narrates a look back at the history of the academic quiz, which is the longest-running programme of its kind on British TV, telling the stories behind its most memorable players. Among those featured are Jenny Ryan, Eric Monkman and Gail Trimble, along with Sandya Narayanswami, who helped change the face of the quiz when back in 1975 she became the first Asian woman to take part. The programme also reveals the secrets of two of the current question-setters for the quiz, and Griff Rhys Jones recalls the infamous Young Ones episode where Scumbag College appeared in a spoof of the programme

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team helps launch the Wild Britain campaign to protect the UK's wildlife. Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin join volunteers transforming an old playing field on the Lincolnshire Fens into a wildlife haven. John Craven heads to Chester Zoo, and Tom Heap looks at the UK's track record for protecting nature, and if a new bill currently going through parliament could undermine it. With special appearances from nature lovers Judi Dench and Deborah Meaden

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: The Fabs were the first all-female group from Wales, brought together inspired by the success of the Beatles. Breaking through in a male-dominated industry was difficult in the 1960s, but Swedish boy band Moonlighters recognised their talents and left a big impression on the girls. Now more than five decades later, members of both bands enjoy a much-anticipated reunion. Plus, ex-addict Simon meets the man who turned his life around and Ellie thanks a teacher who was her rock following a terror attack. Presented by Alex Jones

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The actor begins his trek across the Sahara Desert. Landing in Morocco after crossing the Straits of Gibraltar, he proceeds to scale the High Atlas mountains and meets the Sahawari people, who provide welcome assistance in an inhospitable land. He also rides on the world's longest train, and plays a game of desert draughts

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of two second-round matches. Mark Selby will be involved in one of these contests should he have come through his first-round encounter and will be looking to avoid his fate at this stage last year, when the 2021 champion relinquished his crown following a 13-10 defeat at the hands of Yan Bingtao

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc: Louise's attempts to make a fresh start are frustrated when she meets Frederik again. He involves her in a new case in which a disabled woman has been found dead. In Danish

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc: Louise and Frederik discover a connection between Bjrn and Alberte, who both grew up in the Breidablik commune. Louise goes undercover and soon spots its charismatic leader, Jon. In Danish

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc: British PoW Major Errol Phipps is determined to escape his German captors, but his constant attempts begin to exasperate his fellow prisoners. Eventually, they all manage to evacuate the camp, leaving him behind and believing the conflict is not yet over. Second World War comedy, starring Michael Palin and Roy Kinnear

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc: Members of the Chiddingfold family gather at their spooky ancestral home, leading to a series of deaths as one by one the eccentric residents are murdered and the house descends into inevitable chaos. Comedy, starring Michael Palin and Isabel Dean. First broadcast October 11, 1977

programme.title: British Sitcom: 60 Years of Laughing at Ourselves
programme.desc: A journey through the history of the British TV sitcom, from Hancock's Half Hour in the 1950s to present day shows, revealing the inspiration behind some of the most enduring characters and how comedy has reflected changing attitudes in society. Narrated by Rebecca Front, and featuring contributions from writers and actors including Steve Coogan, Richard Curtis, James Corden, Graham Linehan, Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic returns to examines more of the techniques and conventions behind classic movie genres, beginning by looking at the tropes of British comedies. Mark argues that they win laughs by tapping into the public's abiding national preoccupations, from rooting for the underdog to the subversion of class and manners, as well as the audience's fascination with comedy and crime, and pastiches and parodies that take the big beasts of Hollywood down a peg or two

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The actor begins his trek across the Sahara Desert. Landing in Morocco after crossing the Straits of Gibraltar, he proceeds to scale the High Atlas mountains and meets the Sahawari people, who provide welcome assistance in an inhospitable land. He also rides on the world's longest train, and plays a game of desert draughts

programme.title: Measuring Mass: The Last Artefact
programme.desc: A hi-tech vault just outside Paris is the home of the kilogram, a small metallic cylinder that is used as the base unit of mass - it is the item against which everything else is measured. But over time, this small hunk of metal has mysteriously eroded by the weight of an eyelash, a change that could have dire consequences. This documentary tells the story of the kilogram, and follows a group of scientists as they try to redefine the weight of the world

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team heads offshore to examine stories related to the sea

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: An aerial view of England through the seasons, accompanied by verses from poets ranging from Shakespeare to Philip Larkin. With commentary from John Betjeman, and readings from Michael Hordern, Prunella Scales, Janet Suzman and Richard Pasco. Originally broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day nine at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as two second-round matches continue, including Kyren Wilson v John Higgins

programme.title: The Alehouse Sessions
programme.desc: Norwegian violinist Bjarte Eike and his music group Barokksolistene present a joyful celebration of 17th-century folk music, fiddle tunes, drinking songs, sea shanties and pieces by Purcell and Playford, filmed in one of London's oldest taverns, the George Inn, Southwark

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new stepfather, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc: The story behind The Card Players, one of Cezanne's most famous artworks. Waldemar Januszczak considers how this image of two old men hunched over their game of cards expresses the artist's puzzling religious beliefs, particularly his fascination for Mary Magdalene

programme.title: Christo and Jeanne-Claude: Monumental Art
programme.desc: Documentary which charts the creation of world-renowned artist Christo's first public work of art in the UK, the Mastaba. In the summer of 2018, on the Serpentine in London's Hyde Park, Christo constructed the Mastaba from 7,506 painted oil barrels. The work was inspired by ancient Mesopotamian tombs and weighs six hundred tonnes. It is the latest work in a career spanning half a century and stretching across the world, and the programme looks back on Christo's career and a life spent making provocative works of art with his wife and partner Jeanne-Claude

programme.title: Dawn Chorus: The Sounds of Spring
programme.desc: Filmed without voiceover or music, this programme highlights the call of the birds at sunrise, as those living within Britain's habitats burst into song and reveal the natural splendour of their distinctive chorus

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: An aerial view of England through the seasons, accompanied by verses from poets ranging from Shakespeare to Philip Larkin. With commentary from John Betjeman, and readings from Michael Hordern, Prunella Scales, Janet Suzman and Richard Pasco. Originally broadcast in 1977

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc: The story behind The Card Players, one of Cezanne's most famous artworks. Waldemar Januszczak considers how this image of two old men hunched over their game of cards expresses the artist's puzzling religious beliefs, particularly his fascination for Mary Magdalene

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. Checking into its famous Metropole Hotel, he discovers a bunker where guests sheltered from American bombardment during the Vietnam War. At a former Soviet factory that once supplied military uniforms to the North Vietnamese army and Viet Cong, Michael discovers a progressive new manufacturer providing sportswear to the United States Olympic team. He later views the limestone islets and turquoise waters of Ha Long Bay

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: Documentary about traditional Japanese craftspeople, beginning by following Shiro Kunimitsu and his family as they craft a katana of exceptional sharpness and durability, continuing a tradition begun by their ancestors nearly three centuries ago

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 10 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of the final two second-round matches, including Anthony McGill v Jack Lisowski, as the line-up for the quarter-finals is confirmed. Lisowski was the final player to book his place in the last eight in 2022, edging out 2010 champion Neil Robertson 13-12, and he will be involved in this session if he won his first-round match

programme.title: Flying Scotsman from the Footplate
programme.desc: A guide to life on the footplate of the nation's favourite steam engine. Cameras are placed aboad locomotive 60103 as it travels along the Severn Valley, cutting through stunning landscapes on a journey from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster. The 'cab cameras' capture veteran driver Roger Norfolk and fireman Ryan Green in action as they talk through the mechanics and challenges of operating this national treasure. Needless to say, things sometimes get hot on the footplate and not everything goes exactly to plan

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance
programme.desc: To celebrate its 90th birthday, Barbara Flynn narrates the story of the nation's love affair with the Flying Scotsman - arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, and one that symbolises all that was great about British engineering. In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc: Key players in the Good Friday Agreement relive the all-night negotiations leading up to the treaty, which saw the creation of a unique power-sharing government. However, Tony Blair's compromise on decommissioning failed to overcome local distrust, and once again, the British prime minister faced another Northern Ireland crisis. With contributions from Blair, Bertie Ahern, Bill Clinton and Mo Mowlam

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: The oil palm is a remarkable tree, with an incredibly diverse fruit that can be used for many different things - from shampoo and soap to toothpaste, crisps and chocolate. Unfortunately, the spread of this remarkable plant is leading to the destruction of the rainforests, particularly in Borneo and Sumatra. So what can we do? Firstly, learn where your food is coming from. Pay attention to the labels and look out for sustainable palm oil. We cant get rid of palm oil altogether as it is in countless products, and many of the alternatives would be worse. But there are different ways of making palm oil, some of which will not completely destroy the forests. The next thing you could do is buy some forest for yourself. It is possible to fundraise, to get money to purchase a piece of perfect rainforest and protect it. So why not see if you can wash cars, and buy a piece of forest the size of your classroom, the size of your assembly hall, possibly even the size of your school. Finally, think

programme.title: OZT Goes Wild in Britain : Urban
programme.desc: The OZT brothers pack their binoculars to explore the natural world right on our doorstep, meeting some of the surprising urban wild animals that can be found in our towns and cities. Tyler finds himself holding onto a cliff edge in Bristol to find out why the fastest bird on earth, the peregrine falcon, is quickly becoming the top bird in town. Aaron heads to Devon to reveal how the water vole is being brought back from the brink of extinction. He also lends a helping hand at a wildlife rescue centre as they give two hedgehog patients a new home Back at OZT HQ, bird expert Nadeem pits the brothers against each other to find out which of them is the ultimate bird brain. Cam demonstrates how clever camouflage can help capture incredible wildlife shots similar to those from Sir David Attenboroughs Wild Isles. Meanwhile, Aaron is joined at OZT HQ by the brown rat,one of Britains most successful and adaptable animals, and reveals rat facts galore - but are they all Fact or Fake?

They demonstrate some of their equipment, including Meagaidhs special doggy goggles, which she wears to keep the wind and dust out of her eyes when shes in the helicopter. Tom demonstrates how Meagaidh is lowered from the helicopter all the way down to the ground using a special harness. They also demonstrate a practice rescue mission, playing hide-and-seek with the children to show them how Meagaidhs supernose can follows scents and smells like clues. programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

programme.desc: Love Monster helps Delivery Duckling try to deliver a lost parcel so she can keep her 100 per cent delivery record, but all the clues they find send them down dead ends.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Purple stages a version of Little Red Riding Hood, but can the other Colourblocks stick to the story? Learn about colour mixing with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a cafe and find George from the CBeebies House there! Meanwhile, Baker Tumble plans a surprise tea party for Mr Tumble.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies travel to the Hidey Hup where they all spin around on the Tubby Spinny

programme.title: Bluey

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When the rabbits are forced out of their secret tree-house, they learn that finding a new hideout isn't the hard part - it's keeping it secret

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Macks stall. She chooses the homemade beard and remembers the day she got it. James, Alice and Molly are exhausted because baby Maddy wont sleep. They think theyve tried everything, but Molly points out they havent tried Bob. Bob sings a lullaby, and it seems to work despite Moira nearly ruining things by using her loud vacuum cleaner nearby. Meanwhile, Mack is helping at the Kids Club. Ruby, Euan and Ayesha decide to try and grow a beard. When that doesnt work, they make make their own beards. Mack makes one too and looks a bit like Bob. At the cafe, everyone is enjoying the silence until Molly knocks a jug over and wakes Maddy up. Desperate to get her back to sleep, Molly convinces Alice and James to imitate Bob. They put on their best Bob voices and sing the lullaby, but to no avail. When Molly sees Mack walking past with his Bob beard, she has an idea. Soon everyone has a Bob beard and sings to the baby, but Maddy keeps

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: The Essam family members visit the Brooklyn-Bells. Jess hopes their well-behaved dog, Baxter, will teach Waffle how to be good, but Waffle has other ideas

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The Shallots have discovered acrobatics, and are inspired by the Ribbon Sisters to put on a show

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: When Gran Gran and JoJo find a family recipe for Great Gran Gran's signature Saint Lucian banana bread, they're excited to bake a batch of it! But there's one problem - cake mix has been spilt on the recipe, so they don't know how long to bake it for!

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: When Pepi Nana loses her red pencil, Little Nana finds it under the wardrobe. Because she is small, Little Nana sees things that Pepi Nana might not see. The two friends go for a walk, and along the way Little Nana shows Pepi Nana lots of new things

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Mother Clanger closes her garden to visitors to get a bit of peace. She never imagined the problems this would cause for the Soup Dragon and for Major Clanger

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Wynne Evans explores the BBC Wales archive of the 1970s to share some nostalgia and a few memories of his own. He begins in the year 1970, including Mary Hopkin at the Eurovision Song Contest, a novelist who shares her home with farm animals and some surprisingly familiar tales of strikes, petrol price rises and power cuts. The sports world saw Tony Cordle hit winning runs for Glamorgan at St Helens in Swansea, and there's also footage of the fire on the historic Britannia Bridge over the Menai Strait

Courier Gary delivers high-nutrition ready meals to athletes - including a couple of well-known rugby stars - and back at HQ there's a surprise planned to celebrate founder Huw's 70th birthday

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 3.15pm). All the action from both teams' fourth and penultimate match of the championship, held at Stade des Alpes in Grenoble. France claimed a 33-5 away win in last year's competition, but Wales will hope to produce a more competitive display on this occasion after recording victories over Ireland and Scotland in their opening two matches

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Joe is horrified at the toll London life is taken on an opium-addicted Pip, and tries to persuade him to return to the safety of Gravesend. An unsuspected threat from the past emerges when Pip discovers the true identity of his mysterious benefactor. Frustrated by Estella's reluctance to marry Drummle, Miss Havisham foists another unsuspected suitor on her daughter, who is driven to desperate lengths to seize control of her life

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Bournemouth v West Ham United at Vitality Stadium and Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur at St James' Park. Bournemouth and the Hammers were battling it out for three vital points in their respective bids to avoid relegation, while Newcastle and Spurs continued their quests to finish in the top four. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures in the Women's Super League, including Tottenham Hotspur v Aston Villa and Manchester City v West Ham United

programme.title: Just Jim (2015)
programme.desc: A Welsh teenager leads a lonely life after being rejected by his only friend. He becomes fascinated by a mysterious American who moves in next door, and the new arrival offers him some advice on how to be cool. The youngster starts to develop the life he had always longed for, but begins to wonder if he was happier the way he used to be. Comedy drama, starring Emile Hirsch and Craig Roberts

programme.desc: The story of the woman who can smell Parkinson's disease. Plus, the world of prescription fraud and an investigation into the science of hydration

programme.desc: Stranraer-based paramedics treat a Covid-positive patient who is struggling to breathe, while in Edinburgh, a patient suffers a nosebleed so extreme he is bleeding from his eyes

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh and the team help a family of four in north London by creating a home office for a working mum, while also deep cleaning the appliances and finding space for the plants

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is in the Essex countryside helping a church minister and his wife, who have a budget of 425,000 to make their very first house purchase. Away from the property search, Sonali discovers how conservation and engineering have been combined to create a landmark coastal nature reserve

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Annie appears with a beloved toy car, which she thinks will race off with a sale. However, the dealers are split over its paintwork. Other items being offered to five potential buyers include an Edwardian card table, a quirky voice box and a mystery pot. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores north-east Wales, beginning his journey on a moor near Llangollen to see hen harriers, one of the UK's most threatened birds of prey. He also visits a nature reserve on a bog, discovers the wildlife that has colonised Marford Quarry, and ends his journey on the Dee Estuary, where he sees thousands of wading birds near Point of Ayr

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Joe is horrified at the toll London life is taken on an opium-addicted Pip, and tries to persuade him to return to the safety of Gravesend. An unsuspected threat from the past emerges when Pip discovers the true identity of his mysterious benefactor. Frustrated by Estella's reluctance to marry Drummle, Miss Havisham foists another unsuspected suitor on her daughter, who is driven to desperate lengths to seize control of her life

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Bournemouth v West Ham United at Vitality Stadium and Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur at St James' Park. programme.title: Just Jim (2015)
programme.desc: A Welsh teenager leads a lonely life after being rejected by his only friend. He becomes fascinated by a mysterious American who moves in next door, and the new arrival offers him some advice on how to be cool. The youngster starts to develop the life he had always longed for, but begins to wonder if he was happier the way he used to be. Comedy drama, starring Emile Hirsch and Craig Roberts

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton follows the course of the River Ythan in rural Aberdeenshire, through a landscape of fields and haunted castles to a coast rich in wildlife. On the way, Paul learns how to make a haystack, speak the Doric dialect, has a ghostly encounter with a woman in Fyvie Castle, and visits the ruined home of the poet Lord Byron's family

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Mo McIntyre's grand plan to dig up an ancient stash of paramilitary weaponry and trade the arms for drugs gets under way. In a bid to convince Grace to come back to the work, Stevie calls round to her house and finally reveals something intimate about his personal life

programme.title: Facelift
programme.desc: Darren McKeown and Tom Cronin get the clinic team together to update them on the hospital, which is behind schedule, while the couple navigate the surrogacy laws between the UK and America. All the staff take a trip to London for their annual Christmas night out, and Darren and Tom shop for presents for Ophelia while there

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan invites celebrity athletes Aimee Fuller, Iwan Thomas, Carlton Cole, Ryan Sidebottom, Kadeena Cox, Perri Shakes-Drayton, Pamela Cookey and Phil Vickery to bank money for chosen charities as they answer questions against the clock, blocking out rivals at the end of each round

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are Rachel Riley, Baga Chipz, Liza Tarbuck, Rhod Gilbert, Ore Oduba and Scarlett Moffatt

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Chelsee Healey, Anthony Quinlan, Sophie Duker, Jenny Bede, Ugo Monye, Danny Care, Beverley Craven and Patti Boulaye try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain tries to show a reckless student paramedic how the job is done, only for the new recruit to abandon a patient suffering from chest pains to come to the aid of a shopkeeper who has taken desperate measures to defend himself. Gethin pushes Jan's patience to the limit, Faith learns to trust her children, and Dylan and Donna come to an arrangement

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: As Susan and Charles attend the funeral of Alan Conway, his creation Atticus Pnd and his faithful secretary Fraser are also attending the funeral of Sir Magnus Pye. Much to Susan's horror, she realises that her world and Conway's fiction have more in common than mere coincidence

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leicester City v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Liverpool v Nottingham Forest. programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark (2019)
programme.desc: The shadow of the Bellows family has loomed large in the small town of Mill Valley for generations, and young Sarah Bellows turns her tortured life and horrible secrets into a series of scary stories. These terrifying tales soon have a way of becoming all too real for a group of unsuspecting teens, who stumble upon Sarah's spooky home. Horror, starring Zoe Margaret Colletti and Michael Garza

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the start of the 43rd staging of the 26.2-mile race, as approximately 50,000 competitors take to the streets of the capital. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.desc: A decade after Michaela's murder, a fresh investigation is launched. A star witness is found dead and police re-arrest the two hotel workers found not guilty. This gave Michaela's family hope and has led to a long campaign for justice

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ruben and Lewis have dreamt of having a place on the Formula 1 circuit since they were children. After discovering their passion through go-karting, the teenage drivers and their supportive fathers have teamed up in the hope that they can work together towards a spot on a professional race circuit in high-spec cars. here, the pair meet their hero Lewis Hamilton, getting invaluable advice about breaking into the sport and discussing the lack of diversity that holds so many back

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Extreme Conservation
programme.desc: Nature lover and conservationist Michaela Strachan travels to Turkey to explore its vast pine forests and to meet the people helping to preserve Turkey's precious bee and bear populations. Starting in the west of Turkey, Michaela discovers that many woodlands are facing devastating losses from climate change and human development. She sees first-hand how fires have destroyed vast areas of pine forest, wiping out the trees, villages and the ecosystem within, including millions of honey bees. Michaela meets bee-loving researcher Yonca Tokbas, who fears that Turkish bees are now being pushed beyond their limit, and who is fighting to retain traditional beekeeping practices before it's too late. Next Michaela journeys to the rugged east of Turkey, where the once-continuous pine forests have become a dwindling patchwork of trees due to human development. She discovers the impact of this change on the wildlife and how the natural behaviours of Turkey's migrating brown bears have been disrupt

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: In February 2022, a video emerged of a young Afghan woman screaming for help whilst her door was being kicked in by the Taliban. Yalda Hakim travels to Afghanistan after gaining access to her and her family after they were released from prison and as they plot their escape from Afghanistan to Europe.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. A fair is in town and everyone's talking about one of the rides - Maximum Delirium, a figure-of-eight that freaks them all out. Nobody has ever ridden on it three times in a row as it seems totally impossible... but not for our heroes. If the kids manage it, they'll be the coolest dudes in town hands down!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Lucas' dad is so cool - that must be why Lucas is cool! The kids finally understand that they need cool dads to be cool, but it doesn't look good for them - the only thing they can hope to do is to lie... and make everyone believe that their dads are super-famous! The bigger the lie, the bigger the prize... but it's gonna be tricky, especially when their dads find out when everyone is together at the mall.

programme.desc: Manchester City v Sheffield United (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the semi-final at Wembley Stadium. The Citizens last won the cup in 2019 and are favourites to lift the trophy once again, demonstrating how tough a task the Blades have today when thrashing Championship leaders Burnley 6-0 in the previous round. However, their opponents will be determined to give a good account of themselves in front of the Wembley crowd and cause an upset that would see them reach the final for the first time since 1936. With analysis from Karen Carney, Roy Keane and Ian Wright, reports from Gabriel Clarke, and commentary by Sam Matterface, Lee Dixon and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. A fair is in town and everyone's talking about one of the rides - Maximum Delirium, a figure-of-eight that freaks them all out. Nobody has ever ridden on it three times in a row as it seems totally impossible... but not for our heroes. If the kids manage it, they'll be the coolest dudes in town hands down!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Lucas' dad is so cool - that must be why Lucas is cool! The kids finally understand that they need cool dads to be cool, but it doesn't look good for them - the only thing they can hope to do is to lie... and make everyone believe that their dads are super-famous! The bigger the lie, the bigger the prize... but it's gonna be tricky, especially when their dads find out when everyone is together at the mall.

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.desc: The actor learns about animal exploitation - the good, the bad and the ugly. In Sri Lanka, fishing manta rays is legal but a turtle sanctuary offers hope. In Thailand, he learns more about silk production, and a more animal-friendly alternative, and on the Australian island of Friday Island, he is shown the delicate art of growing pearls. Finally, in the Abrolhos islands, Martin learns about the most valuable catch in Australia's waters

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.desc: A look back at Martin's time in Africa, which left an indelible mark on him. In 2012, he was involved in an extraordinary mission to return lions to the wild in Kenya, and it started with a lion cub called Mugi. This mission had all the makings of a big adventure, both for Mugi and Tony Fitzjohn, the man who was having his dream realised

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A confrontation between hunt stewards and saboteurs leads to the suspicious death of a protester - and makes Jack wonder whether the thrill of the chase has given the horsey set a taste for human blood. Whodunit, starring David Jason as DI Frost, with Bruce Alexander, Sean Pertwee, Del Henney and Tat Whalley

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is delighted that his heroes Hired Gun are reuniting to play at the Midsomer Rocks festival - minus their drummer, who disappeared 30 years ago after driving his car into a quarry. However, a string of bizarre warnings convinces the paranoid lead singer that someone is trying to stop the reunion, and his fears are confirmed when the backing singer drops dead on stage. Radio 2 host Suzi Quatro guest stars

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When director Nick Cheyney is found beheaded by a guillotine on the set of his latest film, Barnaby and Jones are left with no shortage of suspects. The victim, it transpires, was on poor terms with several people in some way connected to the project, including the mother of his child, and an actor who blamed him for ruining his career. Guest starring Nicky Henson

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's former CID colleague Jack Colby left the force under a cloud following a sex scandal involving villagers and officers at Causton police station. Now retrained as a probation officer, Jack is working at a halfway house for reformed criminals, so when he is bludgeoned to death the detective sets out to discover why the past would not leave him alone. With Chris Barrie, Edward Petherbridge, Sue Jenkins, Nigel Harrison and Christopher Fairbank

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Tommy Hicks of the Midsomer Yeomanry finally has his name added to the Midsomer Parva war memorial, though he was shot for cowardice at the Somme in the First World War. It becomes apparent that time has not healed the rift between his descendants and the residents of Hammond Hall, whose patriarch Duggie Hammond pulled the trigger on his comrade all those years ago. A drink-fuelled mock trial of retired colonel Henry Hammond leads to a killing, and Tom Barnaby has to unravel the tangle of bitterness linking property developer Dave Hicks's brood with their neighbours. Drama, guest starring Donald Sinden and George Cole, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A photographer is murdered shortly after exhibiting a compromising picture of Barnaby - who becomes a suspect in the ensuing investigation. Joyce concludes that someone is trying to frame him, and is stunned when he admits to a previous relationship with the murdered man's wife. Jones is forced to work with the irritating Martin Spellman to solve the case. Guest starring Liza Goddard, Adrian Scarborough and Richard Lintern

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer Parva hosts the revival of a traditional pagan festival, but tragedy strikes when curate Alex Dakin is burned alive inside a straw effigy of a woman. The body count rises as an apparent victim of spontaneous combustion, a budding photographer and a newly arrived schoolteacher are the next to be roasted alive. Keith Barron guest stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An American businessman fears his life is in danger while travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris, and offers fellow passenger Poirot $10,000 for protection. After rejecting the proposal, the sleuth wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow in Serbia. Racing against time to find the killer among the passengers, Poirot must look to the past to solve the crime, and is faced with a decision that will haunt him for ever. David Suchet takes the title role in the murder mystery, with guest stars Hugh Bonneville, David Morrissey and Eileen Atkins

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley)

programme.title: Never the Twain
